snippet: The ouster of two state senators who had supported gun control laws was a disgraceful low point in punitive single-issue politicking by the gun lobby.
abstract: Editorial contends the ousters of Colorado State Senators John Morse and Angela Giron, who supported state's new gun control laws, are a low point in punitive single-issue politicking by the gun lobby; maintains the recall fight shows that something sensible can emerge from politicians, as the gun laws survive, even if two worthy incumbents were sacrificed.
lead_paragraph: The ouster of two state senators who had supported gun control laws was a disgraceful low point in punitive single-issue politicking by the gun lobby.

headline.main: Hard Lessons of the Colorado Recall
headline.print_headline: Hard Lessons of the Colorado Recall
